column5: Gullrock Lake Lodge (formerly South Bay). I've never wanted to pull my trailer that far, but have stayed across the lake at Five Lakes Lodge and it always looked like a nice set up for RVs. Some of the other resorts on the chain also have trailer hookups, but this place was originally designed for RV sites and not as an add on.
Check out Lumberjack Lodge on Sturgeon Lake. Lot's of other lakes around. They have RV's sites and rent boats. https://thelumberjacklodge.net/

Check out Cliff Lake Rv Park.Just north on hwy 105.Nice quite area with nice sites.Cliff lake offers some of the best smallmouth fishing around and also has walleye,pike,lake trout and muskies.Beautufull crystal clear water and not that big of a lake.
I was wondering if it was safe to leave fishing gear in the boat at night since there was a camp site so close. Anyone have any input ?
My philosophy is to take the gear in if there is a chance it can be stolen. Losing all your gear means the end of your fishing trip.
I would say for your own peace of mind,go with your own gut feeling on that one.
I’d carry the main items in if your in a new area. For me it’s only 2-3 rods & a small 2 tray tackle box. Just depends how much crap you pack.

If I guide at any camp and happen to do a few days whether iam in a camp boat or my own I always leave my gear in the boat.Guys I guide always ask me if it's safe.i tell them I have never had a problem.Just take my back pack out so I can load it up again with snacks and water.
I wry about the guys I go with,I about got to put a paddle lock on my tackle bag,they always want my secret lures I'm kicking there butt with!
[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6718237]Not much of a secret about a jig.lol.
[QUOTE=prov1800;6718279]It's all about the little tweaking done to the lure.
Take a look at Harris Hill Resort on LOTW.https://harrishillresort.com/Ontario...es-campgrounds Tom

The Landing on Red Gut Bay Rainy Lake - Boreal Resort on Crow Lake Nestor Falls (they also have access to Lake of the Woods just across the road) - Red Wing Resort Morson on Lake of the Woods - If you want a really remote site Agimac Resort, north of Ignace on Indian Lake (requires a 15 mile trip on a graded gravel road) My Pick would be The Landing or Red Wing.
Moosehorn Lodge in Sioux Lookout has a few campsites. https://www.canadafish.com/
Abram Lake Park has a lot of campsites and boats. Haven't been there in a few years, but it was clean, and has the amenities too. Lots of lakes there to fish.
A camp with great walleye fishing and a small, but near the water camping area is O'Sullivan's Rainbow, on O'Sullivan Lake, near Nakina. It is a wilderness area with good fishing, great hosts. Bill
I appreciate all the responses, some good leads there. If anybody has any other camps to look at, I'd love to see it.

Another vote for Birch Dale Lodge www.birchdalelodge.com 708-227-5262 owners name is Marcel. Nice camp sites and boats to rent. Also has a restaurant and bar in the lodge with great food. I have been going to Birch Dale Lodge for 30+ years.
tried to send a private message did you recieve
I did not receive your private message.
sent again if you dont get it , send me a message and i will reply to it.

Snake Falls Camp on Pakwash north of Ear Falls. Nice camper spots and great boats to rent. And even though all the cabins have full baths, they still maintain a really nice shower house.. Great hosts.

I have done many fly-in NW Ontario trips over the years but never a drive-in camp. This year I am changing it up to looking for a drive-in camp. My wife has never fished up there so we would like to combine a week fishing in NW Ontario with another week of visiting the Canadian Rockies, Banff etc. We have a mid-size travel trailer and would like to find a drive-in lodge that has campsites and a boat to rent. It turns out it is hard to find fishing lodges that have campsites. Walleyes are the focus, however, other species would be pursued if there. Thinking July or August. We are flexible on dates. Any and all recommendations or thoughts on good fishing lodges that also have camping spots would be appreciated. Thanks, Ike
Give Temple Bay Lodge a call.
Birch Dale Lodge has RV parking.
I'll add a 3rd vote for Eagle Lake.Several camps offer campgrounds on Gullrock, Wabaskang, LOTW's, LS. etc.
https://www.tomahawkresort.com/ First Class place. You'll need to call them about dates & rates.
Sleepy Dog Cabins has camping spots and boats to rent. Later, Jay
Hobbs Resort on Cross bay of Cedar Lake. Grand Rapids MB.
Oops sorry. I forgot to look at title that says NW Ontario.
Nothing wrong with alittle plug for Manitoba!!

Jim and Julie's Wabaskang Camp - Wabaskang Lake - Perrault Falls This is a fishing camp not a resort. I have fished there 10+ years. Multi-species. 15000 acres but fishes small. Very few rocks/reefs to navigate around.
